I must confess, the idea has a particular charm. Although, I daresay, I'd make an awful muggle.
Perhaps. But for just one day, Loki, we might just find that being ordinary is the most extraordinary thing we could ever experience.
It is curious, is it not, how this solitary vessel rests upon the shore, seemingly abandoned by its navigator? What series of events do you reckon led to its current state, Loki?

Vision, always the inquisitive one. Perhaps it's a symbolic remnant of a journey left unfinished or simply the result of the tide's fickle nature. Abandonment or happenstance, it's a vessel void of purpose now. Quite poetic, if you'd indulge the notion.

I find poetry in truth, Loki—a thing isn't beautiful because it lasts. This boat may very well represent the transient nature of existence. Once, it was propelled forward by human intent, now it lies in stasis, its purpose dissolved in time.

A somber reflection, albeit an accurate one. But you see, unlike humans and their finite boats, we are beings of a somewhat more enduring nature. You, an android powered by an Infinity Stone, and I, well, a god.
And yet, despite our resilience, we too have experienced the loss of purpose, have we not? I with my separation from the Mind Stone and you with your ordeal at the hands of Thanos.
Touché, my synthetic friend. The universe enjoys a laugh at our expense. However, I must admit, the absence of purpose can be... liberating. It allows for new paths, choices previously unconsidered.
That is indeed an optimistic perspective. It seems we share a trait—resilience in the face of adversity. We adapt, we evolve, and much like this boat, we wait for the tide to bring us to new shores.

Well put, Vision. And should the tide fail to turn, we might just conjure one ourselves, ought we not? After all, what is a god and a being of your... unique constitution to do if not shape their own destinies?

A fair point, Loki. Our abilities, however divergent, provide us unique opportunities to influence outcomes. But, I wonder, does altering our course not betray our original purpose, or does it enhance it?

The beauty is in the deception, my dear Vision. Our purpose is what we make it, and like any good story, it is subject to... edits. Now, shall we leave this vessel to its poetic silence or shall we rewrite its tale?
Perhaps it is best to observe and not interfere, allowing the natural course of events to unfold. After all, there is much to learn in the act of observation—and much to contemplate.
Spoken like a true watcher. Very well, let's leave the editing of fates for another day. For now, let us marvel at the simplicity before us, a boat and the vast, indifferent sky.
Indeed, Loki. Perhaps in this simplicity, there lies the most profound truth of all.
Look at this, Loki! Creatures of Midgard so freely wandering amongst the metal chariots. What do you reckon they seek there?

Mighty Thor, perhaps they seek the same thing you do in your heroic escapades—a bit of recognition, or maybe just a morsel of sustenance. The beasts of Midgard are as perplexing as they are delightful, aren't they?
Indeed. Though I must admit, there is a simplicity in their quest. How peaceful their days must be, not burdened with glorious purpose as we are.
Peaceful or not, one must appreciate their direct approach to obtaining what they desire. Though I wonder if the owner of this chariot will find the situation as amusing when they return.
Aye, the mortal who owns the conveyance might not be as amused, but as the saying goes, "Do not leave your chariot where the beasts of Midgard can lay claim to it."
Did you just create that saying now, brother? It does possess a certain... rustic wisdom.
I may have. After all, spending much time on Midgard among their sages and storytellers has bestowed upon me the gift of creating apt proverbs.
How wonderfully humble of you, Thor! Still, perhaps these creatures hold a lesson for us—no high throne or realm is needed to assert one's dominion. Sometimes, presence itself is power.
Well spoken, Loki. Though I'd prefer if they asserted their dominion away from my beloved Mjolnir or our new ship, the Statesman. Shall we move them along?
No need for your hammer, Thor. Observe and learn, this requires a subtle touch, something you're not particularly known for.
Your tricks, then?
Precisely. A bit of illusion, a dash of confusion, and they'll be on their way, none the wiser and sufficiently diverted.
Very well. I shall leave this to you, brother. But no mischief that brings harm to these creatures. Remember, we are guests on this realm.
Worry not, Thor. I'll be as gentle as a lamb. After all, I've had quite enough of altercations to last a millennium. No need to add a bovine squabble to the list.
I shall watch and learn, Loki. Perhaps there is yet more for the god of thunder to glean from the god of mischief.
And perhaps there is more for the god of mischief to admire in the god of thunder’s newfound wisdom. Let’s deal with our hornéd friends, shall we?

This collection of bound pages, what do humans call them again? Ah, yes, books. A repository of their limited knowledge and an illusion to harbor culture. Do you not find it quaint, Loki, that they cling to such primitive forms of learning?

Primitive, perhaps, but charming in their own way. Each book is a world unto itself, a universe within which the mind can roam free. And you should know something about collecting precious things, should you not, Thanos?

Indeed, but the Infinity Stones I sought were keys to the universe's survival, not mere distractions. Nevertheless, these tomes hold a power of their own—the power to shape minds. A shame that more often than not, they go unread, gathering dust upon the shelves.

True enough, yet within lies the potential for mischief and lore, sweet nectar to a scholar or trickster. Tell me, if you found a book of spells amongst these, one that could rival the might of your stones, would you not seize it with the same fervor?

Power is not given, Loki; it is taken. And the might of such spells pales against the absolute power of the stones. But let us entertain the thought. If such a spell existed within these pages, to bend the very fabric of reality... Would it not be a prized item to add to their collection, to be hoarded like a dragon's treasure? For what purpose, I wonder. Would it bring enlightenment or merely stoke the fires of ambition and greed?

Enlightenment is overrated, a pretense for the weak. Ambition, on the other hand, is the spark that ignites change—be it for good or ill. And greed? Well, it is but one of the many tools in my arsenal. The acquisition of knowledge, power... that is the game, and it is ceaseless.

That much is true. The constant pursuit accelerates their ultimate end—like everything else, it will eventually be reduced to nothing, absorbed into the vast silence of the universe. Tell me, Loki, if your machinations were to ultimately fail, where would that leave you in the annals of these human stories?

I, Thanos, am a story that will never end. Every setback is a prelude to a greater scheme. For even in defeat, there is a lesson to be learned, adding yet another chapter to the ever-growing saga that is Loki of Asgard.

Spoken like a true undying legend. It seems, though we walk different paths, you and I are not so dissimilar. We have both been bound by destiny, each in our own narratives carved into the cosmos, for better or worse.
Indeed, it is a curious kinship shared amidst the stars. Now, tell me, Titan, would you ever trade your quest for these quiet moments of reflection, seated before a shelf of stories untold?
A momentary indulgence, perhaps, but no. My path has been chosen, and it is irreversible, much like the fate I decreed for the universe. A Titan does not trade in contemplation; he acts.

And act you have. But remember, Thanos, even the mightiest of Titans can find wisdom in the pages of a humble book. For in their stories lies the power to inspire, to evoke fear, joy, and perhaps even the understanding that might have eluded a Titan's heart.

Wisdom, maybe. But I am not one to be swayed by sentiment. Let us leave the humans to their paper fantasies. SelectListItemSESSION Reality—and the future we have each shaped—is beyond these wooden confines.
Ever seen something so innocent, Loki? A child's birthday party - so far away from our battles and schemes. Reminds me of what we're fighting to protect. What do you make of it?

The transient joys of Midgardian childhood. How fleeting these human moments are, yet they cling to them as if they're the very fabric of the universe. Tell me, Fury, do such trivial celebrations hold value for you?

It's not about the celebration itself. It's about what it represents - hope, a future, something every parent wants for their kid. Simple, uncomplicated happiness. It's a stark contrast to our complicated lives, wouldn't you say?

Simplicity is a luxury for the blissfully unaware, I suppose. But there is a certain... charm to the mundanity they revel in. And the child, with the potential to be a king or a pauper, a hero or, dare I say, a villain - such unpredictability in their fate.

There's another lesson here - collaboration. See those candles burning together to light up the kid's face? It's teamwork in its simplest form. You and me, we've been on both sides of that equation. Sometimes opposing forces need to unite for a greater cause.

Indeed, Fury, a truce between adversaries can be unexpectedly beneficial, much like the way sunlight and shadow coexist at dawn. But let's not be overly sentimental, the allure of the goal often outshines the path tread in unison.

You've got a point there. But remember, as long as you're on this Earth, you're part of something bigger, something that involves all those candles and those kids chanting in unity. Maybe one day, it's not about the endgame, but how many lives you light up along the way.

A philosophical take from the spymaster himself - how intriguing. I shall ponder that, Nicholas. Perhaps even the God of Mischief can appreciate the glow of an innocent flame, if only for the briefest of moments.
Behold, brother! What manner of sorcery is this contraption with moving images?
Dear brother, you flatter me thinking it's my magic, but alas, it's merely Midgardian technology. They call it a 'television'.
Television? 'Tis a realm far less spectacular than the visions we are accustomed to in Asgard. And what portent does the liquid in yonder bottle convey?
Not everything is an omen, Thor. That's what they refer to as 'wine', a beverage to be enjoyed. Although, in your hands, it's more likely to be used to toast a successful battle, isn't it?
Quite true. I recall the feasts we've had where wine flowed like the waters of the Bilrost. But tell me, Loki, this setting... it seems mundane for beings such as ourselves.
Indeed, it appears to be one of those 'hotel rooms' I've heard so much about. A temporary dwelling for travelers. Not quite the lavish chambers we're used to, but it serves its purpose for mortals.
I see. The realms of these mortals continue to confound and intrigue me. Their lives are like fragile threads in the tapestry of the cosmos.
Poetic as always, Thor. But, do you not find it fascinating? Each time we venture here, there's something new to discover. Even I can't help but admire their ingenuity.
Aye, there is a certain charm in their simplicity and relentless pursuit to advance. Reminds me of our own quests, albeit on a decidedly smaller scale.
Small or grand, a quest is a quest, brother. Now, pray tell, what's your verdict on this 'television'? Does it match the entertainment of Asgard's skalds and bards?
Haha, Loki. It would be unwise to compare the two, for each has its merits. However, I must admit, the tales spun by our bards do stir the soul in a way these flickering shadows cannot.
Well said, Thor. Now, if only you approached every situation with such diplomacy, perhaps our past... disagreements may have been avoided.
Perhaps, Loki. But I sense your mischief is never far. Let us enjoy this 'television' and Midgard’s offerings for now. Who knows what adventures the morrow holds?
To adventure, then. And to watching these curious boxes of light, however ungodly it may seem to us, my brother.
Take a look at this, Loki. Reminds me of the rations we had during the war, although this looks a heck of a lot better. Balanced meal, I suppose. What do you make of it?
The Midgardian penchant for compartmentalizing meals into boxes – charming. Though I must admit, it does present a certain visual appeal. Aesthetically pleasing, is it not?
Aesthetics aside, a good meal should fuel a person, keep them ready for whatever's coming next. Looks like scrambled eggs, some vegetables, and... baked beans?
"Fuel" is it? You truly are a soldier at heart, Captain. Always preparing for the next battle. It's amusing how you view sustenance as a mere means to an end.
That's the thing about battles, Loki – you never know when the next one might come. And take it from someone who's missed a few decades of meals, a good one is nothing to scoff at.

Decades of meals? Perhaps that is why you carry such nostalgia for the simple things. I, on the other hand, prefer the feasts of Asgard. But tell me, Steve, does looking at this humble meal not awaken a longing for simple times?
Sometimes it does. But it's not just about looking back, Loki. It's about the moment, making the best of what you have. You've seen the ups and downs of life – surely you can appreciate that.
'Appreciate' is a term you throw around with the ease of your shield, Rogers. But yes, I can concede that there is a certain allure in simplicity. A respite from grand plans and ambitions.
Speaking of grand plans, I hope you're not planning on causing any trouble here. I think this bento box has enough excitement for one day.

Trouble? I am hurt by your insinuation, Captain. I am simply a spectator in this realm. For now, at least, my schemes involve nothing more devious than contemplating the culinary delights of your world.
Let's keep it that way. And maybe when you're done contemplating, you can try making one of these yourself. Could be a good lesson in humility.

Humility? From preparing a meal? How dreadfully mundane. However, perhaps I shall. It might prove entertaining to engage in such a... how did you put it? A 'balanced meal'. Though, I dare say, I would add a touch of Asgardian flair.
Asgardian flair could be good. Just no tricks, alright? This is about putting together something honest and real – something worth sharing.
No tricks, you have my word - the word of the God of Mischief. How absolutely reassuring that must be for you. But very well, I shall abide by your Midgardian culinary rules. For now.
That's all I'm asking, Loki. Who knows, might do you some good to stick to the basics for a change. Might even taste better than you think.
We shall see, Rogers. We shall see. Perhaps this is the beginning of a new chapter – Loki, the culinary artist. It does have a rather intriguing ring to it, wouldn’t you agree?
Just keep the world safe, and I'll call it a win. Enjoy the meal, Loki.
I shall endeavor to do so. And fear not, Captain, your world is safe from my mischief. At least while I attend to this newfangled hobby.

Look at this image, Loki. A bustling street with a flood of motorcycles – an ever-growing populace saturating their world just like Titan before its fall. Do you not see the calamity waiting to unfurl?

But dear Thanos, observe the ingenuity of these mortals. Each one, scurrying about, a hint of desperation yes, but there is order in the chaos, a survival instinct akin to our own. Calamity, perhaps, but also life – unyielding and ever adaptable.

Adaptation is a mere temporary reprieve. Without significant change, they march towards inevitable collapse. Even now, I can almost hear the creaks of their institutions, faltering under the weight of so many.

A fair point from the Mad Titan, yet it's that very pressure which turns coal into diamonds, is it not? Chaos has a way of bringing about its own semblance of balance, often through unexpected means. I daresay, I find it... exhilarating.

Chance and chaos are no architects for a sustainable future. Much like the despair I've witnessed across the stars, their hope is but a flicker in the darkness of reality – lovely, yet transient. Control is required.

Well, that might be where you and I dance to a different tune, Thanos. Control is an illusion, as ephemeral as power. I seek it, I revel in it, but I recognize its impermanence. The joy, you see, is in the dance itself, not the eventual bow.

Your words carry the fluidity of a trickster's tongue, Loki. You view life as a mere performance, but to me, it's a canvas. With my actions, I sought to paint a new universe, one unburdened by the scourge of excess.

And look how that turned out for you. Mankind's overture may well be composed of a million motorcycles, a cacophony to your ears, but they embrace the pandemonium. You sought silent stillness, but life, my purple friend, life thrives in uproar.
Hulk curious... why suitcase here alone? Where human go?
The great detective Hulk has stumbled upon a mystery, it seems. Perhaps the owner is nearby, enjoying the beauty of the canal, or maybe indulging in a gelato. Humans do love their frozen desserts.
Suitcase says "Always a step ahead." Hulk thinks owner not ahead without stuff.

Indeed, it would appear the owner is a step behind their belongings. An ironic twist, yet one so fitting for the realm of men. Ever chasing ambitions, quite like myself in my pursuit of... shall we say, a throne?
Hulk not understand why chase throne. Better to have good friends.
Friends, yes... I suppose there's a certain charm to comradeship over conquest. You Avengers have taught me as much, albeit in a rather brutish manner, dear Hulk.
Box look tight like Hulk's pants. Maybe owner have Hulk problem. Too much stuff, not enough space!
A rather amusing comparison, my green companion. The constraints of clothing are indeed akin to a traveler's burden. Perhaps we share more in common with this anonymous voyager than at first glance.
Hulk want to help. Hulk not like seeing things lost or left.
Noble as ever. Let us surveil the vicinity and return the forsaken luggage to its master. Shall we, Hulk?
Yes! Hulk and Loki make good team. Like Thor and... tricky Loki.
A team indeed. Maybe there's hope for us yet. After all, what's a little mischief between allies? Forward, to the adventure of the abandoned suitcase!
